question: How do I reset my password?
answer:
Step 1: Go to the login page
Step 2: Click 'Forgot Password' link below the login button
Step 3: Enter your registered email address
Step 4: Check your email for a password reset link (arrives within 5 minutes)
Step 5: Click the link in the email to open the password reset form
Step 6: Enter your new password (minimum 8 characters, include uppercase, lowercase, numbers)
Step 7: Confirm your new password by typing it again
Step 8: Click 'Reset Password' button
Step 9: Return to login page and sign in with your new password

question: I forgot my username. How can I recover it?
answer:
Step 1: Go to the login page
Step 2: Click 'Forgot Username' link near 'Forgot Password'
Step 3: Enter your registered email address
Step 4: Click 'Send Recovery Link'
Step 5: Check your email for your username
Step 6: If no email received, check spam folder
Step 7: If still not found, contact support with your registered email
Step 8: Return to login page and enter your username

question: Why am I getting 'Invalid credentials' error?
answer:
Step 1: Verify you are entering the correct username (not email unless that's your username)
Step 2: Check that CAPS LOCK is not turned on
Step 3: Ensure your password is correct (passwords are case-sensitive)
Step 4: If unsure about password, use 'Forgot Password' option
Step 5: Clear your browser cache and cookies, then try again
Step 6: Try logging in from a different browser
Step 7: If error persists, contact support with your username

question: How do I enable two-factor authentication (2FA)?
answer:
Step 1: Log into your account
Step 2: Go to Settings (top-right corner or menu)
Step 3: Click 'Security' or 'Account Security'
Step 4: Find 'Two-Factor Authentication' option
Step 5: Click 'Enable 2FA'
Step 6: Choose your 2FA method (authenticator app, SMS, or email)
Step 7: If using authenticator app, download Google Authenticator or Microsoft Authenticator
Step 8: Scan the QR code displayed on screen with your authenticator app
Step 9: Enter the 6-digit code from your authenticator app
Step 10: Save your backup codes in a safe place

question: White screen appears when first entering the application
answer:
Step 1: Make sure VPN is turned off (VPN can block access)
Step 2: Check your internet connection (minimum 2 Mbps required)
Step 3: Clear app cache (Settings > Apps > [App Name] > Storage > Clear Cache)
Step 4: Force close the app and restart it
Step 5: If issue persists, try restarting your device
Step 6: Update the app to the latest version
Step 7: If still showing white screen, uninstall and reinstall the app
Step 8: Contact support if the issue continues

question: Video not appearing after clicking on a lesson
answer:
Step 1: Check your internet connection (videos require stable connection)
Step 2: Make sure you are using the latest version of the app
Step 3: Clear the app cache (Settings > Apps > [App Name] > Storage > Clear Cache)
Step 4: Try refreshing the lesson page
Step 5: Close the app completely and reopen it
Step 6: Try accessing the video on a different device or network
Step 7: Check if the video is available in your course
Step 8: If video still doesn't appear, contact support with your course ID and lesson ID

question: App is slow or hangs frequently
answer:
Step 1: Check your internet connection speed (minimum 2 Mbps recommended)
Step 2: Close other apps running in the background
Step 3: Clear app cache (Settings > Apps > [App Name] > Storage > Clear Cache)
Step 4: Check if your device has enough free storage space (at least 500MB recommended)
Step 5: Update the app to the latest version
Step 6: Restart your device
Step 7: If performance is still slow, try uninstalling and reinstalling the app
Step 8: Contact support if the issue persists

question: CMD Not Working Error
answer:
Step 1: The error 'Exec command: Error: spawn C:\\Windows\\system32\\cmd.exe' means cmd.exe is missing or not working
Step 2: Open PowerShell as Administrator
Step 3: Run the following command: sfc /SCANNOW
Step 4: Wait for the scan to complete (this may take 15-30 minutes)
Step 5: If errors are found, the system will attempt to repair them automatically
Step 6: Restart your computer after the scan completes
Step 7: Try running the application again
Step 8: If the error persists, contact IT support

question: Infinite Loading Problem - Error aborted timed out
answer:
Step 1: Make sure you can access admin.joacademy.net in your browser
Step 2: Try accessing the site from a different network or restart your router
Step 3: Restart your device
Step 4: Delete the JoAcademy folder from AppData (C:\\Users\\[YourUsername]\\AppData\\Local\\JoAcademy)
Step 5: Reinstall the application
Step 6: Clear your browser cache and cookies
Step 7: Disable VPN or proxy if active
Step 8: If the issue persists, contact Ahmad Aqteish (IT) or submit a ticket to QA

question: White Screen Problem on Windows
answer:
Step 1: Change your network or restart your router
Step 2: Make sure there's no active VPN or antivirus software blocking the connection
Step 3: In Windows search, type 'VPN' and go to settings
Step 4: Turn off VPN if it's enabled
Step 5: Go to Proxy Settings and turn it off
Step 6: Clear browser cache and cookies
Step 7: Try accessing the application again
Step 8: If the problem persists, contact support

question: Remote Desktop Issue - Error JDV-08
answer:
Step 1: The error JDV-08 appears when Remote Desktop is enabled
Step 2: This is a security feature that prevents access from virtual environments
Step 3: To fix: Disable Remote Desktop on your device
Step 4: Go to Settings > System > Remote Desktop
Step 5: Toggle off 'Enable Remote Desktop'
Step 6: Restart your device
Step 7: Try accessing the application again
Step 8: If the error persists, contact support with your device information

question: Windows 7/8 Error on Windows 11
answer:
Step 1: This error occurs when running legacy applications on newer Windows versions
Step 2: Right-click the application executable file
Step 3: Select 'Properties'
Step 4: Go to 'Compatibility' tab
Step 5: Check 'Run this program in compatibility mode for:'
Step 6: Select 'Windows 7' or 'Windows 8' from the dropdown
Step 7: Click 'Apply' then 'OK'
Step 8: Try running the application again

question: Open Anyway Option Not Working
answer:
Step 1: When trying to open the app from settings, the 'Open Anyway' option doesn't respond
Step 2: Open Terminal (press Command+Space, then type Terminal)
Step 3: Run this command: sudo spctl --master-disable
Step 4: Enter your password when prompted
Step 5: Go to System Preferences > Security & Privacy
Step 6: Select 'Anywhere' for allowing apps
Step 7: Try opening the application again
Step 8: After the app works, re-enable security by running: sudo spctl --master-enable

question: What do JDV error codes mean?
answer:
JDV-01: Screen Recording Detected
JDV-02: Virtual Machine or Virtual Environment
JDV-03: Virtual Network (Usually due to VPN)
JDV-04: Hacking Attempt
JDV-05: Hacking Attempt
JDV-06: Use of a Blocked Network
JDV-07: Screen Recording or Hacking Tools
JDV-08: Remote Desktop Enabled
JDV-09: Use of Software that Violates Policies

If you encounter any of these errors, review the specific cause and follow the appropriate troubleshooting steps. Contact support if you need assistance.

question: How do I get my UUID manually on Windows?
answer:
Step 1: Open Command Prompt (CMD) as Administrator
Step 2: Type the following command: for /F 'tokens=3' %A in ('reg query HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Cryptography /v MachineGuid') do @echo %A
Step 3: Press Enter
Step 4: Copy the UUID that appears in the output
Step 5: You can paste this UUID into a SHA256 hash generator if needed
Step 6: Save this UUID for your records
Step 7: Contact support if you need help with your UUID

question: How do I report an issue properly?
answer:
Step 1: Provide a clear description of the issue
Step 2: Include relevant context (when, where, who encountered the issue)
Step 3: Indicate if the issue is continuous or one-time
Step 4: Attach screenshot or video if applicable
Step 5: Include the affected item ID, session ID, or record ID
Step 6: Provide clear, numbered steps to reproduce the issue
Step 7: Include platform/environment information (web, mobile, browser)
Step 8: If possible, include logs or error messages
Step 9: Specify the device/browser details and app version
Step 10: Submit the ticket with all required information

question: What information is needed for issue verification?
answer:
The following information should be included when reporting an issue:

Basic Information:
- User name (must match system records)
- Full description of the issue with context
- Attachments (screenshot, video, or file)
- Item ID or relevant identifier
- Steps to Reproduce (STR) with clear numbered steps

Technical Validation (if possible):
- Logs or error messages
- Backend or browser console logs
- HTTP request/response status codes
- User's device/browser details
- App version and build number
- Time and date of issue occurrence

Internal Checks:
- Reproducibility confirmation
- Business impact assessment
- Number of affected users
- Criticality level (Low, Medium, High, Urgent)
- Any workarounds or additional context

question: What is the Issue Verification Checklist?
answer:
The Issue Verification Checklist is used by Operations and Technical Support teams to ensure all required details are complete before assigning an issue to QA.

Purpose: Ensure comprehensive information gathering before QA assignment

Key sections:
1. Basic Information (user name, description, attachments, item ID, STR)
2. Technical Validation (logs, error messages, environment info)
3. Internal Checks (reproducibility, business impact, criticality)
4. Comments or Notes for QA

All items in the checklist should be verified before submitting the issue to QA. This ensures QA receives complete, actionable information.

question: How do I handle finance or payment issues?
answer:
Step 1: Gather the following information from the user:
- User ID or email address
- Order ID
- Payment method used
- Screenshot of the payment transaction

Step 2: Document the issue clearly (Invoice issue, payment failed, refund request, etc.)
Step 3: Include all relevant transaction details
Step 4: Attach screenshots of the payment screen or error message
Step 5: Note the date and time of the transaction
Step 6: Include any error messages received
Step 7: Submit the ticket to the Finance team with all information
Step 8: Follow up if the issue is not resolved within 24 hours

question: What is Quality Assurance (QA)?
answer:
Quality Assurance is a systematic process of testing and evaluating software to ensure it meets quality standards and user expectations. Key aspects:
- Identifies bugs, defects, and issues before users encounter them
- Ensures functionality, reliability, usability, and performance
- Uses various testing methods: manual testing, automated testing, functional testing, performance testing, user acceptance testing
- Essential for delivering high-quality software and maintaining customer satisfaction
- Performed throughout the development lifecycle, not just at the end

question: What are the different types of testing?
answer:
Functional Testing: Verifies that all features work as intended
Performance Testing: Checks how the system performs under load
Security Testing: Identifies vulnerabilities and security risks
Usability Testing: Evaluates user experience and interface design
Compatibility Testing: Ensures software works across different devices and browsers
Regression Testing: Verifies that new changes don't break existing functionality
User Acceptance Testing (UAT): Final testing by end users before release
Smoke Testing: Quick preliminary testing to identify critical issues
Integration Testing: Tests how different modules work together
Unit Testing: Tests individual components or functions

question: What is a bug vs a defect?
answer:
Bug: A specific flaw or error in the software code that causes unexpected behavior
Defect: The broader term that includes bugs and any deviation from expected behavior

Key differences:
- Bug = specific coding error
- Defect = any issue including design flaws, usability problems, or performance issues

In QA terminology:
- These terms are often used interchangeably
- Technically, a defect is the umbrella term
- When reporting issues to QA, always provide: steps to reproduce, expected behavior, actual behavior

question: How do I report a bug or issue?
answer:
Step 1: Verify that the issue is reproducible (can happen consistently)
Step 2: Gather information: Steps to reproduce, Expected behavior, Actual behavior, Browser/Device, Attachments (screenshots or videos)
Step 3: Go to Support > Report a Bug or use the bug reporting tool
Step 4: Fill in the bug report form with all gathered information
Step 5: Be as detailed as possible in the description
Step 6: Include screenshots or videos showing the issue
Step 7: Specify the severity: Critical, High, Medium, or Low
Step 8: Click 'Submit Bug Report'
Step 9: You will receive a bug ID for tracking
Step 10: The QA team will investigate and update you on the status

question: What is the difference between manual and automated testing?
answer:
Manual Testing:
- QA engineers manually execute test cases without automation tools
- Advantages: Flexible, exploratory testing, better for UI/UX testing
- Disadvantages: Time-consuming, error-prone, not scalable

Automated Testing:
- Uses scripts and tools to run tests automatically
- Advantages: Fast, repeatable, scalable, efficient for regression testing
- Disadvantages: High initial setup cost, not suitable for exploratory testing

Best Practice: Use both approaches
- Manual testing for new features and exploratory testing
- Automated testing for regression and repetitive tests

question: What is regression testing and why is it important?
answer:
Regression Testing: The process of testing previously tested functionality to ensure that new changes or updates don't break existing features

Why it's important:
- Prevents new bugs from breaking old features
- Ensures software stability after updates
- Saves time by automating repetitive tests
- Increases confidence in software quality
- Reduces risk of production issues

Key point: Regression testing is typically automated because it involves running the same tests repeatedly. It's performed after bug fixes, updates, or new feature releases.

question: What is a test case?
answer:
A test case is a set of conditions or steps designed to verify a specific feature or functionality of the software.

A good test case includes:
- Test Case ID: Unique identifier
- Title: Brief description of what is being tested
- Precondition: What must be true before running the test
- Steps: Detailed steps to execute the test
- Expected Result: What should happen if the feature works correctly
- Actual Result: What actually happened (filled in after execution)
- Status: Pass or Fail
- Priority: Critical, High, Medium, or Low

Test cases are the foundation of systematic testing and help ensure comprehensive coverage of all features.

question: How do I write a good test case?
answer:
Step 1: Be specific and clear - write test cases that anyone can understand and execute
Step 2: Keep it simple - one test case should test one specific feature or scenario
Step 3: Include preconditions - clearly state what must be set up before running the test
Step 4: Write detailed steps - each step should be numbered and specific
Step 5: Define expected results - be clear about what should happen if the feature works
Step 6: Make it repeatable - test cases should produce the same result every time
Step 7: Avoid assumptions - don't assume the tester knows the system
Step 8: Use clear language - avoid jargon and be concise
Step 9: Include edge cases - test boundary conditions and unusual scenarios
Step 10: Review and update - regularly review and update test cases as features change

question: What is test coverage?
answer:
Test Coverage: A measure of how much of the software code or functionality is tested by your test cases. It's expressed as a percentage.

Example: 80% test coverage means 80% of the code or features are covered by tests

Types of coverage:
- Code Coverage: Percentage of code lines tested
- Feature Coverage: Percentage of features tested
- Requirement Coverage: Percentage of requirements tested

Goal: Aim for at least 80-90% test coverage for critical features
- 100% coverage is ideal but often not practical
- Tools like JaCoCo, Istanbul, or Codecov can measure code coverage automatically

question: What is the difference between QA and QC?
answer:
QA (Quality Assurance):
- Process-oriented approach
- Focused on preventing defects by improving development processes
- Proactive approach
- Applies to entire project
- Performed throughout development

QC (Quality Control):
- Product-oriented approach
- Focused on identifying and fixing defects in the finished product
- Reactive approach
- Applies to specific deliverables
- Performed at the end

In practice: Both QA and QC work together to ensure quality

question: What is a test plan?
answer:
A Test Plan is a comprehensive document that outlines the testing strategy for a project. It includes:
- Scope: What will and won't be tested
- Objectives: Goals of testing
- Test Strategy: Approach and methodology
- Resources: Team members, tools, and environment
- Schedule: Timeline for testing activities
- Test Cases: What will be tested
- Entry and Exit Criteria: When to start and stop testing
- Risk Assessment: Potential risks and mitigation
- Deliverables: What will be produced
- Sign-off: Approval from stakeholders

A good test plan ensures organized, structured, and comprehensive testing.

question: What is the difference between black box and white box testing?
answer:
Black Box Testing:
- Tester doesn't have access to internal code
- Tests the software from user perspective
- Focus on inputs and outputs
- Advantages: Simulates real user experience
- Disadvantages: Limited coverage of edge cases

White Box Testing:
- Tester has access to internal code
- Tests internal logic and code paths
- Focus on code structure and logic
- Advantages: Better coverage of edge cases
- Disadvantages: Requires technical knowledge

Best Practice: Use both approaches for comprehensive testing
- Black box for user perspective
- White box for code quality
tags: black box white box testing types

question: Why is the platform loading slowly?
answer:
Step 1: Check your internet connection speed (minimum 2 Mbps required)
Step 2: Clear your browser cache and cookies (often resolves slowness)
Step 3: Disable browser extensions that might interfere (ad blockers, VPNs, etc.)
Step 4: Try using a different browser to see if the issue persists
Step 5: Close other applications using bandwidth (downloads, streaming, etc.)
Step 6: Restart your browser and try again
Step 7: If on mobile, ensure you have a strong WiFi or cellular signal
Step 8: Check if the platform status page shows any ongoing maintenance
Step 9: If slowness persists across multiple devices, contact support
